	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Assert.isTrue(Assert.java:109)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Assert.isTrue(Assert.java:95)
	at org.eclipse.jst.jsf.facesconfig.ui.ModelLoader$ModelLoaderJob.loadModel(ModelLoader.java:165)
	at org.eclipse.jst.jsf.facesconfig.ui.ModelLoader$ModelLoaderJob.run(ModelLoader.java:122)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:55)

In the class "org/eclipse/jst/jsf/common/ui/internal/utils/WebrootUtil", the method "getWebContentFolder(IProject)" assumes that the web root folder is always one segment deep within the project (e.g. "/WebContent"). The method should not make this assumption, since the web root folder can be nested in a deeper folder structure (e.g. "/src/main/webapp").

While the fix appears simple, this utility method is used by varied functional areas throughout the JSF project, and all references would need to be checked to ensure they are not broken by a fix to what is currently an incorrect assumption about the web root folder.
Target this for the maint. release.
